ruleJP0002.message: Some error is occurred, when the system is reading the file.

ruleJP0003.message: The system file cannot be opened. Please reinstall the system.

ruleJP0005.message: Annotation file cannot be specified. Please specify the one annotation file.

ruleJP0006.message: Sequence file cannot be specified. Please specify the one sequence file.

ruleJP0007.message: Please check the parameter that is specified invalidly.

ruleJP0008.message: Please specify the parameter as the following format; [-x<annotation file>] [-s<sequence file>]

ruleJP0009.message:
The number of entries in the sequence file is different from that in the annotation file.
Please unify the number of entries.

ruleJP0011.message:
The entry name in the annotation file is different from that in the sequence file.
It is required to sort entries in the same order for both annotation and sequence files.

ruleJP0012.message:
In the sequence file, some extra information is found in the entry line.
Please confirm and re-enter the entry name again, if necessary.

ruleJP0013.message: In the sequence file, there is no entry line. Please enter the entry name.

ruleJP0014.message:
In the sequence file, an invalid code is found. Please correct the nucleotide code.
See the acceptable nucleotide codes.

ruleJP0015.message:
In the sequence file, the termination code for the sequence, "//" is not found.
Please enter the code "//" for the end of sequence.

ruleJP0016.message: In the sequence file, the entry name is found two or more times. Please correct them to be unique.

ruleJP0017.message: In the annotation file, the entry name is found two or more times. Please correct them to be unique.

ruleJP0019.message:
In the annotation file, you entered 6 or more columns in the line. Please delete the illegal column(s).
The number of acceptable columns is five; for Entry, Feature, Location, Qualifier and Value, respectively.

ruleJP0020.message: The number of characters is greater than 40959 bytes/line that is the maximum for a line.

ruleJP0021.message:
The following features are required at least one for COMMON or each of entries;
SUBMITTER, REFERENCE and source

ruleJP0022.message: Null and/or illegal characters are found in the entry name.

ruleJP0023.message: No feature is specified. Please use some appropriate feature.

ruleJP0024.message: DATE and DATATAPE feature can be only entered in the COMMON entry.

ruleJP0025.message: The location is not specified for a biological feature. Please describe some appropriate location.

ruleJP0026.message:
An invalid name for feature is found.
Please note frequently mistyped cases as follows;
1) case sensitivity, to distinguish upper or lower case;
2) missing the underscore character, "_";
i.e. "TRNA" --> "tRNA" ; "misc feature" --> "misc_feature"

ruleJP0027.message:
An invalid name for qualifier is found.
Please note frequently mistyped cases as follows;
1) the case sensitivity, to distinguish upper or lower case;
2) missing the underscore character, "_";
i.e. "Codon start" --> "codon_start"

ruleJP0029.message: DATATYPE/type is specified, the required keyword corresponding to the type is not found.

ruleJP0031.message: Either one of two qualifiers is required for the feature. Please specify one of them.

ruleJP0032.message: The feature can be used only one for one entry.

ruleJP0033.message: The value for the status qualifier, "Published Only in Database" can only be described for the first REFERENCE feature of the entry.

ruleJP0034.message:
There are two or more values, "Published Only in Database" in the entry.
Please specify the status, "Published Only in Database", for the only 1st REFERENCE feature of the entry.

ruleJP0035.message: There is no ab_name qualifier with the value corresponding to the value of the contact qualifier.

ruleJP0036.message: Invalid qualifier is described in REFERENCE with a specified status. Please correct it.

ruleJP0037.message:
The descriptions of the locations are ignored for the following features; SUBMITTER, REFERENCE and COMMENT.
When the number of REFERENCE or COMMENT features is plural, the order of the features in the annotation file is to be same with the order in the flat file.

ruleJP0038.message:
In principle, the acceptable length of sequence is more than 20bp.
Please confirm it again, if necessary.

ruleJP0039.message:
The range of the location of source feature is greater than the sequence length in the sequence file.
Please correct the sequence and/or the description of the location.

ruleJP0040.message:
The sequence length in the sequence file is greater than all ranges of source locations.
Please correct the sequence and/or the description of location.

ruleJP0041.message:
The description of location for source feature may be invalid.
Please confirm the sequence and the description of the location again and revise them, if necessary.

ruleJP0042.message:
The longest location of the source features is not started from 1.
Please confirm the location again and revise it, if necessary.

ruleJP0043.message:
The first base code of the sequence is "n".
Please remove it, because the first nucleotide should not be "n".

ruleJP0044.message:
The last base code of the sequence is "n".
Please remove it, because the last nucleotide should not be "n".

ruleJP0045.message: In the sequence file, the base code other than "n" is found at the location of gap or assembly_gap feature specified in the annotation file.

ruleJP0046.message: In the sequence file, the location that is greater than 10 in the length consists of the only base code, "n", however, there is neither gap or assembly_gap feature corresponding to the location in the annotation file.

ruleJP0047.message:
The location of unsure, gap or assembly_gap feature is invalid.
Any operators, "join", "order" or "complement" are not acceptable for the location of unsure, gap or assembly_gap feature.

ruleJP0053.message:
In an entry with two or more source features, each mol_type qualifier must have the same value.
Please unify them with the same values.

ruleJP0054.message: Either focus or transgenic is required for the qualifier in either of the source features, when two or more source features in an entry with the different values of organism qualifiers.

ruleJP0056.message:
Please delete the qualifier (focus or transgenic) from the source feature.
It can be only used to specify the main source from two or more source features.

ruleJP0058.message: When there are some source features and all of them have the same organism qualifier, the focus qualifier cannot be used.

ruleJP0059.message:
2 or more transgenic qualifiers are found in the entry.
Only one transgenic qualifier can be used for an entry.
Please remove them except either one in the main source feature.

ruleJP0060.message: The transgenic qualifier can be only used for the entry of "SYN" division.

ruleJP0061.message: The division of the entry is "ENV", however, there is no environmental_sample qualifier in the source feature.

ruleJP0062.message: The environmental_sample qualifier is used for the entry, however, 'ENV' is not found in the value of the keyword qualifier.

ruleJP0063.message: The division is not specified as "ENV", though the environmental_sample qualifier is used.

ruleJP0064.message:
The feature cannot refer any other entry for its location.
This rule is applied to operon and other relevant features belonging to the operon transcript.

ruleJP0065.message:
The location of the feature is overlapped with that of some operon feature.
Please add the common operon qualifiers for both features, if necessary.

ruleJP0066.message:
The feature has an operon qualifier, but there is no operon feature that has the same operon qualifier in its value.
Please check the values of operon qualifiers.

ruleJP0067.message: To describe the operon feature, at least one another feature related to the operon is required.

ruleJP0068.message: The feature has an operon qualifier, but it is not overlapped with any operon feature in its location.

ruleJP0070.message:
2 or more ff_definition qualifiers are found in the entry.
Only one ff_definition qualifier can be used for an entry. Please remove them except either one.

ruleJP0072.message: The description of location is invalid. Please correct according to Description of Location.

ruleJP0073.message:
The qualifier is not legal for the feature.
Please correct according to Feature/Qualifier Usage Matrix

ruleJP0074.message:
The mandatory qualifier for the feature is not found.
Please correct according to Feature/Qualifier Usage Matrix

ruleJP0075.message: The value for the qualifier is invalid. Please revise the value.

ruleJP0077.message: The value for the qualifier is not described with the prescribed characters. Please revise the value.

ruleJP0078.message: The value for the qualifier is not described in the prescribed length. Please revise the value.

ruleJP0079.message: The value of experiment qualifier is recommended to be less than 1000 in the number of letters.

ruleJP0080.message: Please correct the duplication of the feature in the entry, if necessary.

ruleJP0081.message:
In the description of the location, the pieces of "join" or "order" can be merged each other.
i.e. "join(1..100,101..200)" â†’ "1..200"

ruleJP0082.message:
In the description of the location, the pieces of "join" or "order" are overlapped with each other.
i.e. "join(1..100,50..200)"

ruleJP0083.message: When the [#QUALIFIER NAME1] qualifier is used for the feature, the [#QUALIFIER NAME2] qualifier is required.

ruleJP0085.message: No qualifier is described, though the location is described in the line.

ruleJP0086.message: For EST entries, either of three following keywords is required; "unspecified EST", "5'-end sequence (5'-EST)" or "3'-end sequence (3'-EST)"

ruleJP0087.message: For TPA entry, either of the following three keywords is required; "TPA:experimental", "TPA:inferential" or "TPA:assembly".

ruleJP0088.message: The qualifier is duplicated in the same feature. Please confirm and correct them.

ruleJP0103.message: There are some '@' letters that do not contribute to the meta-description in the value of qualifier which is allowed to use meta-description.

ruleJP0104.message: In the value of qualifier, there is a description similar to the meta-description of '[qualifier name or entry]'.

ruleJP0105.message: There is no value for the qualifier specified by the meta-description in the "ff_definition".

ruleJP0106.message: The orders of entries in annotation and sequence files are different from each other.

ruleJP0107.message: The entry name is found in the annotation file, however, it is not found in the sequence file.

ruleJP0108.message: The same keyword is found two times in the entry.

ruleJP0109.message: Since the amino acid abbreviation in the qualifier is ambiguous (Asx, Glx, or Xle) or particular (Sec or Pyl), it would cause some problem.

ruleJP0110.message: There is no keyword that is required for the specified DIVISION/division.

ruleJP0111.message: The given keyword is specific to some DIVISION/division, however, the DIVISION/division is not specified.

ruleJP0112.message:
In the sequence file, the location that is greater than 10 in the length consists of the only base code, "n", however, the corresponding gap or assembly_gap feature indicates different location in the annotation file.
Please modify sequence file and/or annotation file to resolve this disagreement.

ruleJP0113.message:
When the value of codon_start is not 1, the location value must be 5' partial type.
Please check the frame of translated amino acid sequence for the corresponding CDS feature.
Please correct either of them, according to Description of Location and Offset of the frame at translation initiation by /codon_start.

ruleJP0114.message: The value of ab_name has possibly format error. Please reconfirm it, and, if necessary, correct it.

ruleJP0115.message:
The same ab_name is found two times in a feature SUBMITTER or REFERENCE.
Please reconfirm it, and, if necessary, correct it.

ruleJP0116.message: The value for the qualifier is not described in the prescribed format. Please revise the value.

ruleJP0117.message: Please remove either one of two qualifiers, because both of two cannot be used in the same feature.

ruleJP0118.message: When you specify the option "-b", it is required to specify the CON division in annotation file.

ruleJP0119.message:
The value for volume, start_page, end_page qualifier is usually described in only numeric character.
Please reconfirm it, and, if necessary, correct it.

ruleJP0120.message: There is insufficient memory. Please allocate memory.

ruleJP0121.message:
The symbolic entry name, COMMON, can be used only in the first of your entries, when you need to specify eatures shared with all of entries in the COMMON entry.
If the following description is entered on the first line, please remove the line.
e.g.) Entry Feature Location Qualifier Value.

ruleJP0122.message: 2 or more qualifiers are found in the feature, however, the qualifier can be specified only one for the feature.Please delete one of them.

ruleJP0123.message: Location includes some invalid character(s). Please revise the location.

ruleJP0124.message: In the beginning or the end of value, extra space(s) is found. Please remove it.

ruleJP0125.message: 2 or more qualifiers are found in the feature, however, the qualifier can be specified only one for the feature.Please change one of them into another qualifier (e.g. note qualifier).

ruleJP0126.message: 2 or more consecutive spaces are found in the value. Please remove extra space(s).

ruleJP0127.message: An entry in the CON division can not be with any entries in other divisions in an annotation file.Please divide the entries into two or more submission files, if necessary.

ruleJP0128.message: Entry name is too long. Please describe it in less than 33 letters of characters.

ruleJP0129.message: Entry name has invalid character(s). Please remove them.

ruleJP0130.message: A comma is found at the end of the value.

ruleJP0131.message: The locations of two source features are possibly overlapping each other.Please reconfirm it, and, if necessary, correct it.

ruleJP0132.message: The same meta-description is found two or more times in the value of qualifier.

ruleJP0133.message: Invalid meta-description is found in the value of the specified qualifier.

ruleJP0134.message: Only "organism" qualifier can be specified by meta-description at the beginning of the value of the "ff_definition" qualifier.

ruleJP0136.message: Except for "@@[organism]@@", please insert a space or beginning parenthesis before meta-description, and insert a space or comma-space, beginning parenthesis or ending parenthesis after meta-description.

ruleJP0137.message: Specified feature should be described for TSA entry.

ruleJP0138.message:
Both "start_page" and "end_page" are not described.
If the reference is a one-page article, please input the same page number in both "start_page" and "end_page".

ruleJP0144.message: No volume qualifier is described, though the "start_page" and "end_page" qualifiers are described in REFERENCE. Please input it.

ruleJP0145.message: Nonsense qualifier is described in REFERENCE with a specified status.

ruleJP0146.message: The value of "end_page" is less than that of "start_page". Please correct it.

ruleJP0147.message:
The values of start_page and end_page are the same.
If the reference is a one-page article, please ignore the message.

ruleJP0148.message:
A base number in location should not have leading zeros. Please remove them.
i.e. "01..100", "1..0100" --> "1..100"

ruleJP0149.message:
The 'hold_date' is specified within 10 days.
We recommend you specify the date with enough time (e.g. six month later).
If your data should be open to public immediately, please delete DATE line.

ruleJP0150.message: Please select keyword defined in standard list.

ruleJP0151.message:
For TPA entry, either of the following three keywords is required; "TPA:experimental", "TPA:inferential" or "TPA:assembly".
Please use either one of the three.

ruleJP0152.message: For anticodon, rpt_unit_range, tag_peptide and transl_except qualifier, their position must be located within each Feature location.

ruleJP0154.message: Qualifier in ST_COMMENT feature is too long. Please describe it in less than 64 letters of characters.

ruleJP0155.message: Qualifier in ST_COMMENT feature has invalid character(s). Please remove them.

ruleJP0156.message: You can't use "@@&&,::" in Qualifier in ST_COMMENT feature (except tagset_id qualifier).

ruleJP0157.message: There is no value for the qualifier in ST_COMMENT. Please enter the value, if necessary.

ruleJP0158.message: The tagset_id qualifier must be set at the beginning of ST_COMMENT feature.

ruleJP0159.message: 2 or more ST_COMMENT feature with same value of tagset_id qualifiers are found in an entry.

ruleJP0160.message: The tagset_id qualifier can be specified only one for the ST_COMMENT feature. Please delete one of them.

ruleJP0161.message: 2 or more qualifiers are found in the ST_COMMENT feature. Please delete one of them, if necessary.

ruleJP0162.message: Invalid qualifier is entered in COMMON entry. Please correct it.

ruleJP0163.message: When the value of exception qualifier is "annotated by transcript or proteomic data", inference qualifier is required in the CDS feature.

ruleJP0164.message: The use of artificial_location qualifier is allowed only for genome-scale annotation.

ruleJP0165.message: Since mRNA or operon feature should be described as a genome annotation, please confirm the mol_type.

ruleJP0166.message:
The combination of feature and qualifier is not recommended for new submissions.
Please correct according to Feature/Qualifier Usage Matrix.
If you need to describe it, please contact us.

ruleJP0167.message:
The feature is not recommended for new submissions.
If you need to describe it, please contact us.

ruleJP0168.message:
The sequence length is greater than all location ranges of PRIMARY_CONTIG features.
Please check alignment between its sequence and cited sequences and locations of PRIMARY_CONTIG features, and correct them, if necessary.

ruleJP0169.message:
You described an old country name for value of country qualifier.
Please update it to the current name, when feasible.

ruleJP0170.message: When you use qualifier 1, qualifier 2 or qualifier 3 is required for the feature.

ruleJP0171.message:
The pair, qualifier 1 and qualifier 2, are found in other feature(s), however, the values are not described in the same way among the features.
Please correct them, if necessary.

ruleJP0172.message: When the value of gap_type qualifier is "within scaffold" or "repeat within scaffold", linkage_evidence qualifier is required for the assembly_gap feature.

ruleJP0173.message: The pseudo qualifier is used. Please replace it by pseudogene qualifier, if necessary.

ruleJP0174.message: The partial flag, ">" and/or "<", is found in the location of source feature. Please remove it.

ruleJP0175.message: The partial flag, ">" and/or "<", is found in the mid of location. Please correct it according to Description of Location.

ruleJP0176.message:
There is some region in the location of either of gap or assembly_gap features overlapping with a CDS feature.
Please divide CDS into two CDS features to avoid the overlap, if necessary.

ruleJP0177.message:
The value for tagset_id qualifier in ST_COMMENT feature is not included in the standard list.
Please reconfirm it, and, if necessary, correct it.

ruleJP0178.message:
The qualifier name in ST_COMMENT feature is not included in the standard list.
Please reconfirm it, and, if necessary, correct it.

ruleJP0179.message:
The length of unsure feature location is greater than 10.
Please reconfirm it, and, if necessary, correct it.

ruleJP0180.message:
In assembly_gap feature, the value of gap_type qualifier is not appropriate, or the linkage_evidence qualifier should be removed.
Please confirm and correct it.

ruleJP0181.message:
It is strongly recommended for WGS, CON, TSA and TLS to describe submitter_seqid qualifier.
Please confirm and add it, if necessary.

ruleJP0182.message: When you use @@[entry]@@ for the value of the submitter_seqid qualifier, do NOT use any other character with it.

ruleJP0183.message: When the value of gap_type qualifier is "contamination", linkage_evidence qualifier with "unspecified" in value is required.

ruleJP1015.message: The given keyword is specific to some DATATYPE, however, the DATATYPE/type is not specified in the COMMON entry.

ruleJP1027.message: For MGA, all of features, SUBMITTER, REFERENCE and source, are required for COMMON entry.

ruleJP1028.message: For MGA, the header line for the sequence includes some invalid character(s). Please revise it.

ruleJP1029.message: In TPA submission, "Published Only in Database" cannot be specified for the status qualifier in the REFERENCE feature.

ruleJP1030.message: Neither DATATYPE/type=TPA nor DIVISION/division=TSA is specified in COMMON entry, though the PRIMARY_CONTIG feature that is specific to TPA or TSA entry is used.

ruleJP1032.message:
The combination of the start and the end positions is invalid in the description of the location.
The direction of the location can be only described from 5' to 3'.
i.e. "500..345" --> "complement(345..500)"

ruleJP1033.message:
There is only one piece of "join" or "order" in the description of the location. Please correct it.
i.e. "join(1..100)" â†’ "1..100"

ruleJP1034.message: The specified location in the annotation file is greater than the sequence length in the sequence file.

ruleJP1036.message: Please remove either one of two qualifiers, because both of two cannot be used in the same feature.

ruleJP1038.message:
Though the value is described, no corresponding qualifier is found in the line.
Please specify some appropriate qualifier.

ruleJP1039.message:
The same features whose locations and qualifiers cannot be distinguished are found at 2 lines.
Please confirm and correct them.

ruleJP1042.message: The value of the citation qualifier is greater than the number of REFERENCE features.

ruleJP1044.message: The checking process is stopped, because the file cannot be opened.

ruleJP1045.message: The qualifier specified by the meta-description in the "ff_definition" is not found in the source feature.

ruleJP1046.message: The qualifier specified by the meta-description in the "ff_definition" is found two or more times in the source feature.

ruleJP1048.message: Specified feature required for TPA submission is not found.

ruleTC0004.message:
This tool can not be started.
Since it is probably caused by system disorder, please contact us.

ruleTC0005.message:
The location of CDS feature is invalid. It is required to fix the error.
Please refer to Description of Location to correct it.

ruleTC0006.message:
The error related to transl_except qualifier.
When you find it, correction is required.
The three-letter abbreviation of amino acid in the value of transl_except qualifier is invalid.
Please confirm the acceptable abbreviations in the site; Amino Acid Codes.

ruleTC0007.message:
The error related to codon_start, transl_except, or transl_table qualifier.
When you find it, correction is required.
Please refer to the format of the qualifier to correct it.

ruleTC0008.message:
The error related to transl_except qualifier.
When you find it, correction is required.
Some locations (<base_range>) in values of transl_except qualifiers are overlapped each other.
So, amino acid translation is performed with regardless transl_except qualifiers.

ruleTC0009.message:
The error related to transl_except qualifier.
When you find it, correction is required.
The location (<base_range>) in value of transl_except qualifier is invalid.
Please refer to the format of transl_except qualifier to correct it.

ruleTC0011.message:
The error related to codon_start or transl_table qualifier.
When you find it, correction is required.
Amino acid translation is performed as the default value, "1".
There are two or more qualifiers in a CDS feature, though the qualifier is available only one by one CDS feature.
Amino acid translation is performed as the default value, "1".

ruleTC0015.message:
The entry name specified in the annotation file is not found in the sequence file.
Confirm and correct the entry name.

ruleTC0016.message:
In the sequence file, an invalid code is found. Confirm and correct the sequence file.
See the acceptable nucleotide codes.

ruleTC0017.message:
The CDS feature is not started by initiation codon. Confirm and correct it.
If the CDS feature is not complete at 5' end, use partial symbol "<" in the location.

ruleTC0018.message:
The CDS feature is not ended by termination codon. Confirm and correct it.
If the CDS feature is not complete at 3' end, use partial symbol ">" in the location.

ruleTC0019.message: Termination codon is found in the mid of the location of the CDS feature. Confirm and correct it.

ruleTC0020.message:
Either of codon_start or transl_table qualifier is unspecified.
Amino acid translation is performed as the default value, "1".

ruleTC0022.message:
The error related to transl_except qualifier.
When you find it, correction is required.
Since the base range of transl_except qualifier is not matched in reading frame of CDS feature, correct the <base_range> of transl_except qualifier.

ruleTC0023.message:
The error related to transl_except qualifier.
When you find it, correction is required.
Since the amino acid of transl_except qualifier is identical to conceptual translation of CDS feature, remove the transl_except qualifier.

ruleTC0024.message: Since you do not specify the amino acid, Met, with the transl_except qualifier, translation start site is not "M".

ruleTC0025.message:
The error related to transl_except qualifier.
When you find it, correction is required.
Since you do not specify stop codon with transl_except qualifier, the end of CDS location is not stop codon.
Correct CDS location or the value of transl_except qualifier.

ruleTC0026.message:
The error related to transl_except qualifier.
When you find it, correction is required.
Since you specify stop codon with the transl_except qualifier, a stop codon is found in the mid of CDS feature.
Remove the transl_except qualifier.

ruleTC0029.message: During amino acid translation of CDS feature, N of codons can not be translated into any of specific amino acids.

ruleTC0030.message: The resource file required to run transChecker is not in the directory.

ruleAP0001.message: Unforeseen error is found. Please contact us.

ruleAP0002.message: Some error is found during opening the specified file.

ruleAP0005.message: The number of columns in a line must be 9, however, the line is not 9 in its number of columns.

ruleAP0006.message: The value of the column in the line is invalid.

ruleAP0007.message: Some inconsistency is found in the values between gap_type and linkage or linkage and linkage_evidence.

ruleAP0009.message: In an object, the minimum value of object_beg must be "1", however, it is not "1".

ruleAP0010.message: In the object, the maximum value of object_end must be sum of all component lengths.

ruleAP0012.message: The range between object_beg and object_end is different from the range between component_beg and component_end.

ruleAP0013.message: The range between object_beg and object_end is different from the value of gap_length.

ruleAP0014.message: The gap that cannot be estimated its length must be set 100.

ruleAP0015.message: The cited sequence specified as this component_id is not found in the file.

ruleAP0017.message: The region of the component is cited two or more times in the object.

ruleAP0018.message: The specified region of the component is out of cited sequence range in the multi-fasta file.

ruleAP0021.message: The specified file is not found.

ruleAP0027.message: When you cite an accession number as a component_id, its version number is required.

ruleAP0029.message: When you cite an accession number as a component_id, its version number must be a positive integer.
